TopicTitle: What Internet Browser do you use?

Articles.Content: I use Chrome, but I'll use Explorer if I have to. What do YOU use?

Chromium

Mac build - [http://www.freesmug.org/chromium](http://www.freesmug.org/chromium)

Windows build - [http://chromium.woolyss.com/](https://chromium.woolyss.com/)

> 
> Chromium
> Mac build - [http://www.freesmug.org/chromium](http://www.freesmug.org/chromium)
> 
> Windows build - [http://chromium.woolyss.com/](https://chromium.woolyss.com/)

Is it better then Chrome?

Google Chrome.

Internet Explorer really is that bad.

> 
> Is it better then Chrome?

It doesn't have sheisty Google analytics collection baked in, so I would say it's very preferable to Chrome.

A good comparison : [http://www.howtogeek.com/202825/what%E2%80%99s-the-difference-between-chromium-and-chrome/](https://www.howtogeek.com/202825/what%E2%80%99s-the-difference-between-chromium-and-chrome/)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-12T02:59:37Z" title="07/12/2015 02:59  AM" data-short="8 yr">July 12, 2015</time> by segaprophet**

Iron. Its chrome but (allegedly) it does not ever send data to google.

Sadly, chrome extentions no longer work with it.

I use Pale Moon (with adblocking and script blocking extensions) for most of my browsing, it's a fork of Firefox that retains the older interface before they tried to copy Chrome and is compatible with all the legacy extensions.

For Google services (gmail and youtube) I use Chrome (with an adblocker naturally) since they're already getting data back from those sites and I don't have to worry about random compatibility issues.

Iceweasel, Konqueror & links ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif) (70/20/10%). Seen too many browsers come and go to get attached to any one in particular.
Safari on my OS X partition, Firefox on Linux Mint. Safari is certainly the prettiest browser I've ever used, but not quite as functional as Firefox.

> 
> I use Pale Moon (with adblocking and script blocking extensions) for most of my browsing, it's a fork of Firefox that retains the older interface before they tried to copy Chrome and is compatible with all the legacy extensions.

Why don't you just use [Classic Theme Restorer](https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/classicthemerestorer/)?
Firefox with Classic Theme Restorer, Adblock, and Inbox Notifier Plus.

I use [Google Ultron](http://ultronbrowser.info/).

Sorry, couldn't keep a straight face. Erm... I just use Firefox. With Adblock.
Firefox, Iceweasel... etc.
I used to use Safari a lot, but Chrome is much more convenient for me as it autofills in usernames and other stuff.

> 
> I use Pale Moon (with adblocking and script blocking extensions) for most of my browsing, it's a fork of Firefox that retains the older interface before they tried to copy Chrome and is compatible with all the legacy extensions.
> For Google services (gmail and youtube) I use Chrome (with an adblocker naturally) since they're already getting data back from those sites and I don't have to worry about random compatibility issues.

I used to use Pale Moon a lot, and to be honest I actually have no clue why I switched over to new Opera, but somehow I did, even if it is harder on the system resources than PM.

However, my favourite browser was, is and will be (until such time as someone makes a better one) the OLD Opera, =<12.17 version. 

I just miss Presto engine that much. Shame they switched to skinning Chrome instead of making a proper browser ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

> 
> Chrome is much more convenient for me as it autofills in usernames and other stuff.

Totally unsafe, yet totally convenient.

*(I also like that feature)*

IceDragon. It's a fork of Firefox with some additional security features, and a different design. The only reason I switched to it from Firefox was that my Firefox got some weird virus or something, which opened random ad windows at random intervals. In everything else, IceDragon is pretty much the same.

Wait.... There are Internet browsers now!? That'll change everything! 

Wait, it has? Oh...

Jokes aside, I use Chrome and Firefox... Internet Explorer has been really slow for me...

All of them. Ok, not all, but all of the major ones. Even IE, which I use for work purposes. Even links, on the rare occasions I'm stuck in a command-line environment. I despise the memory-and-resource-hog Chrome and have stopped using it for every site that isn't run by Google, but I do still use it nearly daily. I tend to default to Firefox or Safari, depending on what I'm doing and where I'm doing it from.

Fun fact: Chrome's user agent impersonates both that of Firefox *and* Safari!

And don't forget that almost every browser's user agent begins with Mozilla! What a terrible world, eh?
I use Safari, Mac is my machine. Though I do have Windows (yuck) on a VM for work, and there I mostly use Firefox.

Telnet to port 80.

Firefox, links, and IE (for work-related stuff).
Safari all the way!
Chrome is my main one, but I'll often use firefox as well.
Chrome mostly for no particular reason and firefox
